text: Salif Keïta Traoré (6 December 1946 – 2 September 2023), known as Keita, was a Malian footballer. He played for Mali national team. ==Career statistics== ===Club=== Appearances and goals by club, season and competition Club Season League League League Cup Cup Continental Continental Total Total Club Season Division Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Real Bamako 1963–64 Real Bamako 1964–65 21 8 0 0 1+ 3 22+ 11 Real Bamako Total 21 8 0 0 1+ 3 22+ 11 Stade Malien 1965–66 Malian Première Division 24 12 0 0 5+ 14 29+ 26 Real Bamako 1966–67 Malian Première Division 26 15 26 15 Saint-Étienne 1967–68 Division 1 18 12 18 12 Saint-Étienne 1968–69 Division 1 33 21 2 1 35 22 Saint- Étienne 1969–70 Division 1 31 21 4 1 35 22 Saint-Étienne 1970–71 Division 1 38 42 2 0 40 42 Saint-Étienne 1971–72 Division 1 29 29 2 0 32 29 Saint-Étienne Total 149 125 10 2 159 127 Marseille 1972–73 Division 1 18 10 0 0 18 10 Valencia 1973–74 La Liga 30 7 — 30 7 Valencia 1974–75 La Liga 22 11 — 22 11 Valencia 1975–76 La Liga 22 5 — 22 5 Valencia Total 74 23 — 74 23 Sporting CP 1976–77 Primeira Divisão 24 15 — 24 15 Sporting CP 1977–78 Primeira Divisão 21 7 2 0 23 7 Sporting CP 1978–79 Primeira Divisão 18 10 2 0 20 10 Sporting CP Total 63 32 4 0 67 32 New England Tea Men 1979 NASL 21 6 — 21 6 New England Tea Men 1980 NASL 18 11 — 18 11 New England Tea Men Total 39 17 — 39 17 Career total Career total Career total 414 242 20+ 19 434 261 ==Honours== Real Bamako *Malian Cup: 1963–64, 1965–66, 1966–67 *African Cup of Champions Clubs: runner-up 1966 Stade Malien *African Cup of Champions Clubs: runner-up 1965 Saint-Étienne *Ligue 1: 1967–68, 1968–69, 1969–70; runner-up 1970–71 *Coupe de France: 1967–68, 1969–70 *Trophée des Champions: 1967, 1968, 1969 Sporting CP *Primeira Liga: Runner-up 1976–77 *Taça de Portugal: 1977–78; runner-up 1978–79 Mali *African Games: runner-up 1965 *Africa Cup of Nations: runner-up 1972 Individual *African Cup of Champions Clubs: Best goalscorer 1965, 1966 *African Footballer of the Year: 1970 Decorations *FIFA Order of Merit: 1996 ==References== Category:1946 births Category:2023 deaths Category:Malian footballers Category:People from Bamako
